intro: Nhandiroba harmsii, commonly known as the Brazilian candlewood, is a small evergreen tree native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark-barked trunk and dense, glossy green foliage. Its small, fragrant flowers are followed by edible, reddish-brown fruits that attract various bird species. Due to habitat loss, Nhandiroba harmsii is considered endangered and is protected in some regions.
